body.name: Stereo Audio Amplifier Receiver, 300Wx2 Home Dual Channel Bluetooth 5.0 Sound Speaker AMP, Home Amplifiers FM Radio, USB, SD Card, with Remote Control Home Theater Audio Stereo System Components
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 mins
features: HiFi Stereo AMP ▶ -- This Dual channel stereo digital amplifier offer 300W+300W peak power and 40W+40W rated power. Amplifier can input 12-240V.

Bluetooth 5.0 ▶ -- Built-in bluetooth 5.0 core, no pop, no audible noise when Bluetooth connection is established, designed for the customers who pursue HiFi sound. (NOTE: Please keep the distance within 30ft/10m between the device and amplifier without any wall blocking. But if you are connecting whith TV or PC devices, please keep the distance within 15ft/5m.)

USB 2.0/SD Card Input ▶ -- The sound amplifying mixer device features a USB/SD card input to support flash drives or SD card. Allows you to play your favorite audio files from your computer's media library when you connect it directly to the amp.

Bass & Treble Control ▶-- Designed with volume, treble and bass control knobs for more delicate adjustment of the sound, much fun and high playability. Include controller for distant audio adjustments. Note: There is an isolation plastic sheet at the bottom of the remote control, which needs to be removed before use.

Wide Application ▶ -- Compatible with mobile phones, computers, tablets, notebooks, TVs and projectors with AV audio etc. Recommend for home TV audio, computer audio system-game, tower Speaker, garden speaker. Small simple compact design also for car audio system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I usually never a review but this is good.
reviews.reviewText: I hooked my DVD player, and the FM antenna and synced my phone and it all works perfectly. The sound quality is great. This is an amazing price for what you get. This thing has a lot of power. I am shocked at how good this is!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little receiver.
reviews.reviewText: I am using this little guy in my garage, and it pushes great sound through my Klipsch tower speakers. Loud enough for anything I would ever need them to do. Blowing the neighbors away with them...haha!For the price, this will work great for a small set-up, and it doesn't get hot!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars For the Price, Surprisingly GOOD
reviews.reviewText: Needed some inexpensive receiver for some audio once in a while outside the house. I've bought a lot of cheap junk in the past so there was some trepidation about getting this thing, but for the price it actually is pretty good and exceeded my expectations. Most people should like this product unless you're an enthusiastic audiophile.What's really good for me is it has an SD card as well as USB port to just play some music, plus of course bluetooth. It replaces a cheap stereo I used with a built in CD player, but with just 10 watts per channel it just wasn't enough.OK, to the nuts & bolts:PROSGood, clean sound at low to moderate volumeNice clip-type speaker portsAmazing size factorRMS 40 watts per channel is pretty decentTakes 4 ohm speakers tooSD card/USB portCONSNo balance controlNo headphone jackNo AMNo tuning dialFM antenna is a jokeInadequate manualAlways starts in Line modeAmp makes some noiseAs said, it puts out some decent sound at low to medium volume. It has simple clips in the back for the speaker wires - just open, insert, and that's it. No idiotic screw ports which are a big PITA. It's size & weight are really astonishing - easy to fit nearly anywhere, plus you can run it off of AC or DC, and since it can handle 4 ohm speakers too (like car stereo speakers), it can work great for a tailgate or beach party. Wasn't interested in the mic inputs or karaoke, so didn't try it out.There are a few shortcomings or quibbles. While it does have treble and bass control, it has none for balance. There is no headphone jack, nor any AM, though that may not matter to some people. There is no way to easily dial in any FM station - it all operates on memory functions, so if you go to some other distant place, expect to have to program it all over again. The manual never explains this nor how to save stations. The antenna you get is near useless, but you can get a cheap 75 ohm antenna online. In fact the manual says very little at all about anything. And while a minor thing, the receiver always starts up in Line mode, not what you used last. The amp also makes some noise, sort of like crinkling paper - from the unit, not through the speakers. It's noticeable at low volumes but not really at anything higher. It has one RCA input in the back, but this thing really isn't made to be a primary home stereo. For a garage, small bedroom, or college dorm, this might be just what you're looking for.So will this rival a Sony or Pioneer receiver costing five times more? Of course NOT. But for its price and what it is, it's actually quite remarkable. If you want more power, there's also the AK55 unit as well. You can easily just put in an SD card or flashdrive with your favorite tunes, and play it away - that's something the entry level Japanese receivers don't even offer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brought my old Bose 901’s to life!
reviews.reviewText: For its price, size and adaptability , what a great product this is! My old, but really good Bose 901 speakers is now full of life again. It’s great to listen to the classic Kashmir and the Great Gig in the Sky once again. The nine mid-range units sound so good again! Nice product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this specifically to connect my firestick to my speakers and to use for Kareoke. It does not connect to Firestick via Bluetooth. However I found a fix. The Logitech audio adapter can plug into this and seamlessly connects Bluetooth to Firestick. Together it works perfectly for my use. Would be 5 star if it connected to my Firestick on its own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I'm listening to it using Linux Mint 21.2.1. I would like a better device description when the device is paired. It shows up as "BT", I think it should maybe say "AK-45".2. I first hooked it up to LINE. I set the main volume control and it was working fine.3. Changed to Bluetooth and there was no sound at first. For some reason it did not retain the volume control setting between LINE and BLUE. After a bit of confusion, I tweaked the volume setting and it worked. The volume knob has a line on it, so I would think if I don't turn it, it would have some initial volume.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid little device
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace our old shop receiver after it stopped working. This thing is perfect and easy to setup, it does its job and we now have music in our work shop again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars good for the price, not for audiophiles
reviews.reviewText: this amplifier is absolutely nothing special, but does the trick for a decent price. i bought this to test a pair of pa speakers until i could get a better amp.although it was able to run my 800 watt speakers very loud, the audio quality above half volume was poor and clipped. the amplifier itself also makes a high pitched buzz when turned on, which i found extremely annoying.the bluetooth range on this is kind of a joke, i can’t even leave the room and stay connected to bluetooth. there is no way to turn on bluetooth pairing mode either, so if someone already has their phone connected they have to turn off bluetooth on their phone.lastly, i had to return and replace the first one that i ordered because it did not work at all, it would power on and everything but the output didn’t work. all in all this is an ok amplifier maybe for some smaller speakers or if you’re just a normal enjoyer and not an audiophile.
El precio lo dice todoSolo para hacer ruido y ya
